fr.umlv.wallj.game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.umlv.wallj.game.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Displayable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements Displayable
    Represents a player in the game. A player has coordinates (the (x, y) fields}, and implements Displayable as it can be drawn in the graphic window.
    Author:
    Severin Gosset - Denis Biguenet.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int x, int y)
      Creates a new player in the given x, y positions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
      Draws the player in the given graphic context.
      int getX()
      Returns the abscissa of the position of the player
      int getY()
      Returns the ordinate of the position of the player
      void moveOneCell(Node next)
      Moves the player of one case towards the given node The player must be adjacent to the node.
      void setPos(int x, int y)
      Sets the position of the player.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • moveOneCell

        public void moveOneCell(Node next)
        Moves the player of one case towards the given node The player must be adjacent to the node.
        Parameters:
        next - the node to go.

        public void setPos(int x,
                   int y)
        Sets the position of the player.
        Parameters:

        Returns the abscissa of the position of the player

        public int getY()
        Returns the ordinate of the position of the player

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
        Draws the player in the given graphic context. The player is represented by a red circle, and is not drawn if its not on the board.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Displayable
        Parameters:
        graphics - the graphic in which the Displayable must be drawn.
